title: CHANGE THIS TO BE THE TITLE OF YOUR POST
text:
story goes here for first chart


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(gt)
library(patchwork)
library(ggrepel)
library(ggalt)

bballhits <- read_csv("mlb_hitter_stats_1914_2024.csv") |> 
  mutate(Player=gsub("#","",Player, fixed=TRUE)) |> 
  mutate(Player=gsub("*","",Player, fixed=TRUE))

bballvalue <- read_csv("mlb_hitter_value_1914_2024.csv") |> 
  mutate(Player=gsub("#","",Player, fixed=TRUE)) |> 
  mutate(Player=gsub("*","",Player, fixed=TRUE))

royalshits <- bballhits |> 
  filter(Team == "KCR") |> 
  filter(Season > 1984) |> 
  filter(grepl("\\*6", Pos) == TRUE)

royalsvalue <- bballvalue |> 
  filter(Team == "KCR") |> 
  filter(season > 1984) |> 
  filter(grepl("\\*6", Pos) == TRUE) |> 
  mutate(PlayerSeason = paste(Player, season)) 


bobby2023 <- royalshits |> 
  filter(Player == "Bobby Witt Jr.") |> 
  filter(Season == "2023")

bobby2024 <- royalshits |> 
  filter(Player == "Bobby Witt Jr.") |> 
  filter(Season == "2024")

bobbyvalue2023 <- royalsvalue |> 
  filter(Player == "Bobby Witt Jr.") |> 
  filter(season == "2023")

bobbyvalue2024 <- royalsvalue |> 
  filter(Player == "Bobby Witt Jr.") |> 
  filter(season == "2024")

bar1 <- ggplot() +
  geom_bar(data = royalsvalue, aes(x=reorder(PlayerSeason, oWAR), weight=oWAR), fill = "lightgrey") +
  geom_bar(data = bobbyvalue2023, aes(x=reorder(PlayerSeason, oWAR), weight=oWAR), fill = "#004687") +
  geom_bar(data = bobbyvalue2024, aes(x=reorder(PlayerSeason, oWAR), weight=oWAR), fill = "#004687") +coord_flip() +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    x="", 
    y="oWAR" 
    )

bar2 <- ggplot() +
  geom_bar(data = royalsvalue, aes(x=reorder(PlayerSeason, dWAR), weight=dWAR), fill="lightgrey") +
  geom_bar(data = bobbyvalue2023, aes(x=reorder(PlayerSeason, dWAR), weight=dWAR), fill = "#004687") +
  geom_bar(data = bobbyvalue2024, aes(x=reorder(PlayerSeason, dWAR), weight=dWAR), fill = "#004687") +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    x="", 
    y="dWAR"
    )

bar1 + bar2 + 
  plot_annotation(
    title = "Offensively, Bobby Witt Jr. is helping his team win",
    subtitle = "In his second year in the league, Witt no only beat himself, but topped every other \n shortstop in the offensive category. Defense was a different story.",
    caption = "Source: Sports Reference | By Olivia Davenport"
  )  & 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
  )









Story goes here for second chart


Code
careerRvalues <- royalsvalue |> 
  group_by(Player) |> 
  summarise(
    CareerRfield = sum(Rfield),
    CareerRbat =sum(Rbat)
    )
ggplot() +
  geom_dumbbell(data=careerRvalues, aes(y=Player, x=CareerRfield, xend=CareerRbat),
    size = 2,
    colour = "lightgrey",
    colour_x = "#BD9B60",
    colour_xend = "#004687") +
  theme_minimal() +
    labs(title = "Nebraska's defense wasn't as bad as you think", 
         subtitle = "blah blah blah",
         y="",
         x="Runs Contributed vs Runs Stopped") +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
    ) 


Warning: Using the `size` aesthetic with geom_segment was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
ℹ Please use the `linewidth` aesthetic instead.









story for third graph here


Code
career <- royalshits |> 
  group_by(Player) |> 
  summarise(
    CareerHR = sum(HR),
    CareerRBI = sum(RBI),
    CareerDoubles = sum(`2B`),
    CareerTriples = sum(`3B`),
    Offense = CareerHR + CareerRBI
  )
Scoring <- career |> 
  pivot_longer(
    cols=starts_with("C"),
    names_to="Type"
  )

 ggplot() +
   geom_bar(data=Scoring, aes(x=reorder(Player,Offense), weight=Offense, fill = Type)) +
   scale_fill_manual(values=c("#004687","#BD9B60","#7AB2DD","lightgrey"), name="") +
   coord_flip() +
   theme_minimal() +
   labs(
    x="", 
    y="Offensive Production",
    title="At the plate, Witt is a problem for pitchers", 
    subtitle="With over 200 fewer games under his belt, Bobby Witt Jr. is neck and \n neck with Ángel Berroa when it comes to the plate.", 
    caption="Source: Sports Reference | By Olivia Davenport"
    ) +
     theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
    )
